description.plain: Sheppard is an Australian indie pop band from Brisbane, formed in 2009. The band consists of 6 members with a former member to the side that was with the group from 2012 to 2013. Their debut studio album, Bombs Away, was released on 11 July 2014, and peaked at No. 2 on the ARIA Albums Chart and was certified gold by the Australian Recording Industry Association, while their second single, “Geronimo”, spent three weeks at No. 1 on the ARIA Singles Chart and was certified 5× platinum.

body.plain: Sheppard is an Australian indie pop band from Brisbane, formed in 2009. The band consists of 6 members with a former member to the side that was with the group from 2012 to 2013. Their debut studio album, Bombs Away, was released on 11 July 2014, and peaked at No. 2 on the ARIA Albums Chart and was certified gold by the Australian Recording Industry Association, while their second single, “Geronimo”, spent three weeks at No. 1 on the ARIA Singles Chart and was certified 5× platinum.

songs.title: Geronimo

description.plain:
Geronimo (2014) is a song by Sheppard. Is was written by Jay Bovino,Amy Sheppard and George Sheppard. The track was produced by Stuart Stuart. The song was a big hit in Australia peaking at number 1. It also charted on the Billboard hot 100 at 53.

The title of the song is a reference to the famous Apache military leader Geronimo, and the custom of yelling his name before doing a courageous act. Geronimo is pictured below (far right).

songs.embed_content: Read “Geronimo” by Sheppard on Genius

body.plain:
Geronimo (2014) is a song by Sheppard. Is was written by Jay Bovino,Amy Sheppard and George Sheppard. The track was produced by Stuart Stuart. The song was a big hit in Australia peaking at number 1. It also charted on the Billboard hot 100 at 53.

The title of the song is a reference to the famous Apache military leader Geronimo, and the custom of yelling his name before doing a courageous act. Geronimo is pictured below (far right).

songs.lyrics:
43 ContributorsGeronimo Lyrics[Verse 1]
Can you feel it? Now it's coming back
We can steal it if we bridge this gap
I can see you through the curtains of the waterfall
When I lost it, yeah, you held my hand
But I tossed it, didn't understand
You were waiting as I dove into the waterfall

[Chorus]
So say Geronimo, say Geronimo
Say Geronimo, say Geronimo
Say Geronimo, say Geronimo
Say Geronimo
[Post-Chorus]
Can you feel my love?
Bombs away, bombs away
Bombs away
Can you feel my love?
Bombs away, bombs away
Bombs away
Say Geronimo

[Verse 2]
Well, we rushed it, moving way too fast
That we crushed it, but it's in the past
We can make this leap through the curtains of the waterfall

[Chorus]
So say Geronimo, say Geronimo
Say Geronimo, say Geronimo
Say Geronimo, say Geronimo
Say Geronimo

[Post-Chorus]
Can you feel my love?
Bombs away, bombs away
Bombs away
Can you feel my love?
Bombs away, bombs away
Bombs away
You might also like[Bridge]
Well, I'm just a boy with a broken toy
All lost and coy at the curtains of the waterfall
So it's here I stand as a broken man
But I've found my friend at the curtains of the waterfall
Now I'm falling down through the crashing sound
And you've come around at the curtains of the waterfall
And you rushed to me and it sets us free
So I fall to my knees at the curtains of the waterfall

[Chorus]
So say Geronimo, say Geronimo
Say Geronimo, say Geronimo
Say Geronimo, say Geronimo
Say Geronimo, say Geronimo

[Post-Chorus]
Can you feel my love?
(Say Geronimo, say Geronimo)
(Say Geronimo, say Geronimo)
Bombs away, bombs away
(Say Geronimo, say Geronimo)
Bombs away
(Say Geronimo, say Geronimo)

[Outro]
Can you feel my love?
(Make this leap)
(Make this leap)
(Make this leap)
(Make this leap)
Can you feel my love?39Embed

songs.title: Coming Home

description.plain:
“Coming Home” is a song by Australian indie pop band, Sheppard. The song was released on 10 November 2017.

The song is about the feeling of returning home, whether that be after a vacation, or just for a visit.

songs.embed_content: Read “Coming Home” by Sheppard on Genius

body.plain:
“Coming Home” is a song by Australian indie pop band, Sheppard. The song was released on 10 November 2017.

The song is about the feeling of returning home, whether that be after a vacation, or just for a visit.

songs.lyrics:
12 ContributorsComing Home Lyrics[Verse 1]
I've been stuck in motion
Moving too fast
Tryna catch a moment but it slips through my hands
All I see are long days and dark nights
I'm lost without you, but I'm on my way, so hold tight

[Chorus]
I'm coming home tonight
Meet me in the valley where the kids collide into the morning
Oh my god, my town is coming alive (coming alive)
I'm coming home tonight, I know you're ready for the sparks to fly
Into the morning
Oh my god, my town is coming alive
'Cause I'm coming home tonight
'Cause I'm coming home tonight
[Verse 2]
Don't wanna spend my whole life catching my breath
'Cause I've been running 'round and 'round and 'round
And I've got nothing left
There's nothing like a sunset skyline
To let you know you're almost home
So breathe in, and hold tight

[Chorus]
I'm coming home tonight
Meet me in the valley where the kids collide into the morning
Oh my god, my town is coming alive (coming alive)
I'm coming home tonight, I know you're ready for the sparks to fly
Into the morning
Oh my god, my town is coming alive
'Cause I'm coming home tonight
Yes, I'm coming home tonight

[Bridge]
Time has a way of diluting emotions
But I won't let distance get in between us, no

[Chorus]
Oh, I'm coming home tonight
Meet me in the valley where the kids collide into the morning
Oh my god, my town is coming alive (coming alive)
I'm coming home tonight, I know you're ready for the sparks to fly
Into the morning
Oh my god, my town is coming alive
Tonight
'Cause I'm coming home tonight
You might also like[Outro]
Oh, woah (oh, woah)
Oh, woah (oh, woah)
Oh, woah (oh, woah)
Oh, woah, oh5Embed
